R0.nl_constraint: Person7, plane2 and plane3 should be ignored

children.nl_constraint: Person7, plane2 and plane3 should be ignored
children.encoding:
(always 
  (and
    ;; person7 should not board or debark any aircraft at any city
    (forall (?a - aircraft ?c - city) 
      (= (n_board person7 ?a ?c) 0))
    (forall (?a - aircraft ?c - city) 
      (= (n_debark person7 ?a ?c) 0))
    
    ;; plane2 should not be used in any actions
    (= (n_refuel plane2) 0)
    (forall (?c1 ?c2 - city) 
      (= (n_flyslow plane2 ?c1 ?c2) 0))
    (forall (?c1 ?c2 - city) 
      (= (n_flyfast plane2 ?c1 ?c2) 0))
    (forall (?p - person ?c - city) 
      (= (n_board ?p plane2 ?c) 0))
    (forall (?p - person ?c - city) 
      (= (n_debark ?p plane2 ?c) 0))
    
    ;; plane3 should not be used in any actions
    (= (n_refuel plane3) 0)
    (forall (?c1 ?c2 - city) 
      (= (n_flyslow plane3 ?c1 ?c2) 0))
    (forall (?c1 ?c2 - city) 
      (= (n_flyfast plane3 ?c1 ?c2) 0))
    (forall (?p - person ?c - city) 
      (= (n_board ?p plane3 ?c) 0))
    (forall (?p - person ?c - city) 
      (= (n_debark ?p plane3 ?c) 0))
  )
)
children.e2nl: Person7 is never allowed to board or disembark any aircraft in any city. Plane2 must not be refueled, flown at any speed, or used for boarding or deboarding passengers. The same restrictions apply to plane3.

content.text:
<documents>
<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain zenotravel)
        ;(:requirements :typing :fluents)
        (:types
                locatable city - object
                aircraft person - locatable
        )
        (:predicates
                (located ?x - locatable ?c - city)
                (in ?p - person ?a - aircraft)
        )
        (:functions
                (fuel ?a - aircraft)
                (distance ?c1 - city ?c2 - city)
                (slow_burn ?a - aircraft)
                (fast_burn ?a - aircraft)
                (capacity ?a - aircraft)
                (total_fuel_used)
                (onboard ?a - aircraft)
                (zoom_limit ?a - aircraft)

                (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)
        )

        (:action board
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?p ?c)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (located ?p ?c))
                        (in ?p ?a)
                        (increase (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_board ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action debark
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (in ?p ?a)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (in ?p ?a))
                        (located ?p ?c)
                        (decrease (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_debark ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action flyslow
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a))))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total_fuel_used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyslow ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action flyfast
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (<= (onboard ?a) (zoom_limit ?a)))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total_fuel_used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyfast ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action refuel
                :parameters (?a - aircraft)
                :precondition (and (> (capacity ?a) (fuel ?a))

                )
                :effect (and (assign (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a))
                        (increase (n_refuel ?a) 1))
        )

)
</pddl_domain>
<pddl_problem>
(define (problem ZTRAVEL-3-10)
(:domain zenotravel)
(:objects
	plane1 - aircraft
	plane2 - aircraft
	plane3 - aircraft
	person1 - person
	person2 - person
	person3 - person
	person4 - person
	person5 - person
	person6 - person
	person7 - person
	person8 - person
	person9 - person
	person10 - person
	city0 - city
	city1 - city
	city2 - city
	city3 - city
	city4 - city
	city5 - city
	)
(:init
	(located plane1 city4)
	(= (capacity plane1) 2326)
	(= (fuel plane1) 205)
	(= (slow_burn plane1) 1)
	(= (fast_burn plane1) 2)
	(= (onboard plane1) 0)
	(= (zoom_limit plane1) 10)
	(located plane2 city2)
	(= (capacity plane2) 12132)
	(= (fuel plane2) 1469)
	(= (slow_burn plane2) 4)
	(= (fast_burn plane2) 9)
	(= (onboard plane2) 0)
	(= (zoom_limit plane2) 9)
	(located plane3 city3)
	(= (capacity plane3) 5204)
	(= (fuel plane3) 1532)
	(= (slow_burn plane3) 2)
	(= (fast_burn plane3) 7)
	(= (onboard plane3) 0)
	(= (zoom_limit plane3) 8)
	(located person1 city1)
	(located person2 city2)
	(located person3 city1)
	(located person4 city4)
	(located person5 city5)
	(located person6 city1)
	(located person7 city0)
	(located person8 city2)
	(located person9 city1)
	(located person10 city5)
	(= (distance city0 city0) 0)
	(= (distance city0 city1) 619)
	(= (distance city0 city2) 565)
	(= (distance city0 city3) 886)
	(= (distance city0 city4) 596)
	(= (distance city0 city5) 766)
	(= (distance city1 city0) 619)
	(= (distance city1 city1) 0)
	(= (distance city1 city2) 561)
	(= (distance city1 city3) 756)
	(= (distance city1 city4) 760)
	(= (distance city1 city5) 980)
	(= (distance city2 city0) 565)
	(= (distance city2 city1) 561)
	(= (distance city2 city2) 0)
	(= (distance city2 city3) 657)
	(= (distance city2 city4) 702)
	(= (distance city2 city5) 639)
	(= (distance city3 city0) 886)
	(= (distance city3 city1) 756)
	(= (distance city3 city2) 657)
	(= (distance city3 city3) 0)
	(= (distance city3 city4) 546)
	(= (distance city3 city5) 510)
	(= (distance city4 city0) 596)
	(= (distance city4 city1) 760)
	(= (distance city4 city2) 702)
	(= (distance city4 city3) 546)
	(= (distance city4 city4) 0)
	(= (distance city4 city5) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city0) 766)
	(= (distance city5 city1) 980)
	(= (distance city5 city2) 639)
	(= (distance city5 city3) 510)
	(= (distance city5 city4) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city5) 0)
	(= (total_fuel_used) 0)
)
(:goal (and
	(located plane1 city4)
	(located person1 city4)
	(located person2 city5)
	(located person3 city4)
	(located person4 city0)
	(located person5 city2)
	(located person6 city3)
	(located person8 city0)
	(located person9 city3)
	(located person10 city4)
	))

(:metric minimize (total_fuel_used))





)
</pddl_problem>
</documents> 

<information>
The user will give as input a natural language constraint that must be translated into PDDL3.0. The translation will be used by a PDDL planner.
</information>

<instructions> 
- Translate the input constraint into correct PDDL3.0.
- The resulting PDDL3.0 constraint must capture the same meaning as the initial input constraint.
- Remember that PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based. They can only refer to existing precates and fluents, thus, not to actions.
- Be sure to include temporal logic like operators in your translation.
- Format your answer such as there is no preambule and such that the PDDL translation is between the tags <pddl> and </pddl>.
</instructions>

<user_input>
Person7, plane2 and plane3 should be ignored
</user_input>

The user wants me to translate the constraint "Person7, plane2 and plane3 should be ignored" into PDDL3.0.

This is an interesting constraint. What does it mean for these objects to be "ignored"? In the context of planning, this likely means that these objects should not be used in any actions during the plan execution.

Looking at the domain, I can see the following actions:
- board: involves a person and an aircraft
- debark: involves a person and an aircraft  
- flyslow: involves an aircraft
- flyfast: involves an aircraft
- refuel: involves an aircraft

So for person7 to be "ignored", it should not participate in any board or debark actions.
For plane2 and plane3 to be "ignored", they should not participate in any board, debark, flyslow, flyfast, or refuel actions.

However, PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based and cannot directly refer to actions. They can only refer to predicates and fluents.

One way to express this is to ensure that the state never changes in ways that would indicate these objects were used. But this is tricky because we need to think about what would indicate usage.

Actually, let me think about this differently. The domain has some counter functions that track action usage:
- (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
- (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
- (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
- (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
- (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)

These functions count how many times each action is performed with specific parameters.

So to ensure person7, plane2, and plane3 are "ignored", we can require that:
1. For person7: all n_board and n_debark counters involving person7 remain 0


2. For plane2: all n_board, n_debark, n_flyslow, n_flyfast, and n_refuel counters involving plane2 remain 0
3. For plane3: all n_board, n_debark, n_flyslow, n_flyfast, and n_refuel counters involving plane3 remain 0

I'll track the constraint using the domain's action counters, ensuring these specific objects are never used in any actions throughout the plan.

The PDDL constraint will prevent person7 from boarding or disembarking any aircraft, and restrict plane2 from participating in any refueling, slow flight, or fast flight actions across all cities. I'll continue defining the comprehensive constraint to ensure zero activity for these specific entities.

The next constraint extends similar restrictions to plane3, prohibiting its refueling, slow and fast flight movements, and preventing any persons from boarding or disembarking this aircraft in any city. These systematic constraints effectively immobilize specific aircraft and limit person7's transportation options.

<pddl>
(always 
  (and
    ;; person7 should not board or debark any aircraft at any city
    (forall (?a - aircraft ?c - city) 
      (= (n_board person7 ?a ?c) 0))
    (forall (?a - aircraft ?c - city) 
      (= (n_debark person7 ?a ?c) 0))
    
    ;; plane2 should not be used in any actions
    (= (n_refuel plane2) 0)
    (forall (?c1 ?c2 - city) 
      (= (n_flyslow plane2 ?c1 ?c2) 0))
    (forall (?c1 ?c2 - city) 
      (= (n_flyfast plane2 ?c1 ?c2) 0))
    (forall (?p - person ?c - city) 
      (= (n_board ?p plane2 ?c) 0))
    (forall (?p - person ?c - city) 
      (= (n_debark ?p plane2 ?c) 0))
    
    ;; plane3 should not be used in any actions
    (= (n_refuel plane3) 0)
    (forall (?c1 ?c2 - city) 
      (= (n_flyslow plane3 ?c1 ?c2) 0))
    (forall (?c1 ?c2 - city) 
      (= (n_flyfast plane3 ?c1 ?c2) 0))
    (forall (?p - person ?c - city) 
      (= (n_board ?p plane3 ?c) 0))
    (forall (?p - person ?c - city) 
      (= (n_debark ?p plane3 ?c) 0))
  )
)
</pddl>
